channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: ‘Uncanny Valley’: ICE’s Secret Expansion Plans, Palantir Workers’ Ethical Concerns, and AI Assistants
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, our hosts dive into WIRED’s scoop about a secret Trump administration campaign extending right into your backyard.

item.title: Bafflingly, over half of Aussie households have said 'no thanks' to NBN Co's speedy new tiers
item.description: Despite NBN Co making it easier than ever to upgrade to a fast NBN plan, it seems millions of Australians have yet to jump on the bandwagon.

item.title: Musk needed a new vision for SpaceX and xAI. He landed on Moonbase Alpha.
item.description: "I really want to see a mass driver on the moon that is shooting AI satellites into deep space."

item.title: OpenAI President Defends Trump Donations, Refuses to Comment on ICE
item.description: Are you just an apolitical defender of AI if you give money to fascists?

item.title: NASA Puts 21-Year-Old Spacecraft on Pause to Keep It From Crashing Into Earth
item.description: A rescue mission could reach the gamma-ray observatory this summer.

item.title: ‘Scarlet’ Is a Ravishing Vision Undercut by a Glib ‘Hamlet’ Reimagining
item.description: Mamoru Hosoda’s medieval, isekai-adjacent epic about a princess’s brutal quest for revenge is now playing in theaters.

item.title: The iRobot takeover is complete – but it looks like the Roomba brand is clinging on to its US roots
item.description: Roomba's parent brand might have a new Chinese owner, but it's still a 'US-based global consumer robotics company'.

item.title: Nvidia’s new technique cuts LLM reasoning costs by 8x without losing accuracy
item.description: Researchers at Nvidia have developed a technique that can reduce the memory costs of large language model reasoning by up to eight times. Their technique, called dynamic memory sparsification (DMS), compresses the key value (KV) cache, the temporary memory LLMs generate and store as they process prompts and reason through problems and documents.While researchers have proposed various methods to compress this cache before, most struggle to do so without degrading the model's intelligence. Nvidia's approach manages to discard much of the cache while maintaining (and in some cases improving) the ...

item.title: This Tiny Comet Pulled Off a First-of-Its-Kind Spin Flip
item.description: A fresh analysis of Comet 41P/Tuttle-Giacobini-Kresák observations suggests it abruptly reversed its spin after its last Earth flyby—an extreme and unprecedented change.

item.title: PlayStation State of Play February 2026: all the news and trailers
item.description: Strap in, because the next PlayStation event is going to be a long one. Sony’s latest State of Play — a showcase event for upcoming PS5 games — kicks off on February 12th at 5PM ET and it’ll last more than an hour. We don’t know what exactly will be shown. Sony says that the […]

item.title: Cursor claims more than 30,000 Nvidia engineers commit 3x more code and make coding 'a lot more fun than it used to be', but is it too good to be true?
item.description: Cursor claims Nvidia engineers produce three times more code using AI tools, yet industry observers remain skeptical about the quality and stability of the code.

item.title: Anthropic has vowed to pay for electricity price hikes from its data centers. Its plan is short on details
item.description: The Claude AI chatbot maker has joined a growing crop of tech companies that are promising to cover the rising costs of their power needs. If you live near an AI data center, you may already be seeing higher electricity bills. But if that data center is for Anthropic, the AI company now says it will cover the price hikes consumers face.

item.title: Waymo Announces Its Next Generation of Robotaxis
item.description: The company's newest driving system is key to its pans to expand into more cities this year.

item.title: Trump’s anti-DEI policies are hurting college-educated Black women
item.description: A new analysis captures how Black women have been impacted by Trump’s cuts to the federal workforce and attacks on diversity, equity, and inclusion. Faced with a sluggish job market, American workers got a bit of good news yesterday, with the release of the latest jobs report. Employers added 130,000 jobs in January—more job growth than the economy has seen in months—and the unemployment rate dropped ever-so-slightly to 4.3%. But not all workers stand to benefit equally from this surge in job creation. ...

item.title: An AI agent just tried to shame a software engineer after he rejected its code
item.description: When a Matplotlib volunteer declined its pull request, the bot published a personal attack. Sign of the times: An AI agent autonomously wrote and published a personalized attack article against an open-source software maintainer after he rejected its code contribution. It might be the first documented case of an AI publicly shaming a person as retribution. ...

item.title: Researchers Jailbreak ChatGPT to Find Out Which State Has the Laziest People
item.description: You're not gonna believe this but it reflects common human biases.

item.title: ‘The Last Sacrifice’ Explores the (Maybe?) Occult Crime That Inspired ‘The Wicker Man’
item.description: The absorbing new documentary draws on retro movies and vintage TV specials to give context to Britain’s fascination with folk horror.

item.title: More Americans than ever love being single. But they feel penalized for it by our financial system
item.description: Being a ‘free agent’ is becoming a lifestyle, according to a new survey, with many saying they want ‘single-friendly’ benefits like tax breaks. Single this Valentine’s Day? You’re not alone. New research from The Harris Poll shows that nearly half of Americans (46%) are not in relationships—many of them on purpose.

item.title: Better than flowers - here are my favorite Lego sets from $12.99 that you can build together
item.description: Lego sets you can build together!
